titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Gorsuch, Judgment
CWG10967

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Jefferson Circuit
October Term 1861
October 24th 1861

The Commonwealth Plff
against } Indict Felony
James Gorsuch Deft.

The defendant being solemnly called to appear in discharge of the recognizance entered into by him in the City Court of Louisville on the 7 September 1861 came not, but made default. It is therefore considered by the Court that the Clerk of this Court issue a write of scire facias against the said James Gorsuch together with James G. Gorsuch, L. B. Bates, Abm. P. Gorsuch, H. F. Simrall, John Joyes & Jeff Brown his bail returnable &c to shew cause why if any they have or can why the Commonwealth shall not have judgement and execution thereon against them for sixteen hundred Dollars the said James Gorsuch in Eight hundred dollars and the said James G. Gorsuch, L. B. Bates, Abm. P. Gorsuch, H. F. Simrall, John Joyes & Jeff Brown in a like sum according to the form & effect of said recognizance and for a breach of the conditions thereof. And on motion of plaintiff a capias is awarded her against the said James Gorsuch returnable &c which capias shall be endorsed bail in eight hundred dollars with good security in a like sum conditioned &c And all further
proceedings are continued until the next term of the Court.

A Copy
Attest James P. Chambers

The Commonwealth
vs } Copy of Judgt
James Gorsuch
